title: Magnetism - paramagnetic object in external field

content.question: A wire made of aluminum, which is paramagnetic, has magnetic domains as shown on the left. A permanent magnet is placed near the wire and the magnetic domains in the wire align, as shown on the right. The magnet is then removed. Which of the following best represents the magnetic domains in the wire after the magnet is removed?

choices.label: The figure shows magnetic domains separated by dashed lines with arrows in each domain all directed toward the top of the page in an orderly alignment.
The figure shows magnetic domains separated by solid lines with arrows in each domain pointing in different directions in a random arrangement.
The figure shows magnetic domains separated by dashed lines with arrows in each domain all directed toward the bottom of the page in an orderly alignment.
Cannot be determined without knowing the strength of the magnetic field created by the magnet

content.answer: The figure shows magnetic domains separated by solid lines with arrows in each domain pointing in different directions in a random arrangement.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
